heisig_chinese_memo: A cave can act as a dance hall.  Just listen to the crazy acoustics!
Ru_trainchinese: tīng: (сущ) зал, гостиная; государственное учреждение или департамент
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Children love to throw things like nails in empty halls and factories to hear the reverberated sound it makes.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle from " the Rock " from " ear " from the " mouth ", " 𦔻 " is " listening to " the beginning of the text, like the sound out of the mouth to the ear into the room, " 𦔻 " here as a sound character. The inscriptions from " guang ", "宀" and " guang " are all like houses, and they are used as radicals. "Shuowen Tongxun Dingsheng": "Ting, today is called the hall."

The Jiajin inscription is pronounced " Ting ", and the four sacrifices are: "Cai (in) call the hall (Ting)". The big court is the Guang court of the ancestral house.

Note A bronze inscription " Office " and later the " hall " different, future Hall refers to the official local office or entertainment room for guests, "Yun. "Qing Yun": "Ting, the ancient ruler of the government called it "listening," but the latter language was simple and said to listen, so it was broadened."
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle from "宀" from " ear " from " mouth ", " 𦔻 " is the initial text of " listening ", as the sound symbol. The inscriptions from " guang ", "宀" and " guang " are all like houses. The original meaning is hall.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「宀」從「耳」從「口」，「𦔻」是「聽」之初文，象聲出於口而入於耳，「𦔻」在這裏用作聲符。金文從「广」，「宀」、「广」皆象房屋之形，作為偏旁通用。《說文通訓定聲》：「庭，今俗謂之廳。」

　　甲金文讀作「庭」，四祀𠨘其卣：「才(在)召大廳(庭)」。大庭即宗廟太室的廣廷。

　　注意甲金文「廳」與後世的「廳」不同，後世廳指官府辦公的地方或招待客人用的房間，《集韻．青韻》：「廳，古者治官處謂之聽事，後語省直曰聽，故加广。」
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從「宀」從「耳」從「口」，「𦔻」是「聽」之初文，作為聲符。金文從「广」，「宀」、「广」皆象房屋之形。本義是廳堂。

甲骨文從「 宀 」從「 耳 」從「 口 」，「 𦔻 」是「 聽 」之初文，象聲出於口而入於耳，「 𦔻 」在這裏用作聲符。金文從「 广 」，「 宀 」、「 广 」皆象房屋之形，作為偏旁通用。《說文通訓定聲》：「庭，今俗謂之廳。」 甲金文讀作「 庭 」，四祀𠨘其卣：「才(在)召大廳(庭)」。大庭即宗廟太室的廣廷。 注意甲金文「 廳 」與後世的「 廳 」不同，後世廳指官府辦公的地方或招待客人用的房間，《集韻．青韻》：「廳，古者治官處謂之聽事，後語省直曰聽，故加广。」
Oracle from " the Rock" from " ear" from the " mouth", " 𦔻" is " listening to" the beginning of the text, like the sound out of the mouth to the ear into the room, " 𦔻" here as a sound character. The inscriptions from " guang", " 宀" and " guang" are all like houses, and they are used as radicals. "Shuowen Tongxun Dingsheng": "Ting, today is called the hall." The Jiajin inscription is pronounced " Ting", and the four sacrifices are: "Cai (in) call the hall (Ting)". The big court is the Guang court of the ancestral house. Note A bronze inscription " Office" and later the " hall" different, future Hall refers to the official local office or entertainment room for guests, "Yun. "Qing Yun": "Ting, the ancient ruler of the government called it "listening," but the latter language was simple and said to listen, so it was broadened."

廳字的基本解释

廳
tīng
见“厅”。

廳字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tīng］
［《廣韻》他丁切，平青，透。］
亦作“厛1”。亦作“庍3”。亦作“廰1”。亦作“1”。“厅1”的繁体字。
(1)官署中听事问案之处。
(2)会客、宴会、行礼用的大房间。
(3)清代于新开发地区设厅，与州、县同为地方基层行政机构。其长官为同知或通判。又有直隶厅，与府平行。
(4)清末内阁及各部所设掌理政务之机关。如承宣厅、承政厅、参议厅等。民国以来，省政府之下亦有民政厅，财政厅、教育厅等。现多用为大机关里一个办事部门的名称。

廳字的康熙字典解释

【寅集下】【广字部】　廳； 康熙笔画：25； 页码：页352第24
【廣韻】他丁切【集韻】湯丁切【正韻】他經切，?音汀。【廣韻】廳，屋也。【集韻】古者治官處，謂之聽。事後語省，直曰聽，故加广。【增韻】聽事，言受事察訟於是。漢晉皆作聽，六朝以來，乃始加广。

廳字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
廳字的起名意思

暂无。

hall
tīng

hall
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tīng］
["Guang Yun" He Ding cut, flat green, through. ]
Also known as "厛1". Also known as "庍3". Also known as "廰1". Also called "1". Traditional characters for "hall 1".
(1) The place of hearing and questioning in the official office.
(2) Large rooms for receptions, banquets, and salutes.
(3) In the Qing Dynasty, government offices were established in the newly developed areas, which were the same local basic administrative agencies as the prefectures and counties. The chief officer is the same knowledge or communicator. There is also Zhili Hall, parallel to the mansion.
(4) In the late Qing Dynasty, the cabinet and various ministries set up government agencies in charge of government affairs. Such as Chengxuan Hall, Chengzheng Hall, Senate Hall, etc. Since the Republic of China, the provincial government has also had the Civil Affairs Department, the Finance Department, and the Education Department. Now it is often used as the name of a department in a large organization.
hall
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Yin Ji 2] [Guang Zi Department] 　 Hall; Kangxi Strokes: 25; Pages: Page 352 and 24
[Guang Yun] He Ding Cut [Ji Yun] Tang Ding Cut [Zheng Yun] He is cut through,? Yin Ting. [Guangyun] Hall, house. 【Jiyun】The ancients governing officials are called listening. Afterwards, the language is saved, and it is straightforward to listen, so it can be broadened. 【Zeng Yun】Listen to the matter, say that the matter is subject to litigation. Both the Han and Jin dynasties were listened to, and since the Six Dynasties, it began to broaden.
